isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - CAB - TILT: 9800 - REMOVE AND INSTALL - CAB DOORS AND HINGES

svcprocinfo.para: Doors used on the cab are of aluminum riveted construction with all components easily accessible if required. The door is mounted on piano type hinges and door adjustment is accomplished at elongated holes in door half of hinge and shims between the door hinge and the door. The striker pin is also adjustable on the door latch pillar. Service on the door and its components is covered in paragraphs which follow.

When replacing a door on a vehicle, the door components will have to be removed from the old door; if not usable, replaced and installed on the new door. Refer to the proper procedure for the component being removed/installed.

svcsubproc.title: Remove

step1.para: Use a sling or padded chain through top of window opening and attach sling to overhead hoist to support door ( Figure 38).

figure.caption: Figure 38. Attach Sling to Overhead Hoist to Support Door

note.para: If door has electric windows, courtesy lights, heated mirrors or CB antenna, disconnect wiring to remove door.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 39 for Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

step1.para: Remove 2 check arm bracket mounting bolts (Item 6).
Remove interior and courtesy light door switch (Item 7) and disconnect electrical wire.
Remove 7 hinge mounting bolts (Item 5) securing hinge and door to cab door hinge pillar ( Item 2, Figure 40) and remove door.
Move door to work bench or other support as required. Cover bench with a material that will not scratch painted surfaces of door.
To remove door hinge from door, scribe the position of door hinge at upper and lower corners on door. This will help when re-installing hinge back on door.
Remove 6 mounting bolts (Item 9) securing hinge to the door. If adjustment shims (Item 10) are present, observe how many are found and where they are located. Save for installation.
Remove 2 mounting bolts (Item 8) and remove check arm assembly (Item 3) and hinge from door.
To remove door check arm (Item 3), remove cotter pin (Item 1) from door check arm pin (Item 2). Remove door check arm pin and detach door check arm from door check arm bracket (Item 4).

svcsubproc.title: Install
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 39 for Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

step1.para: If door hinge was removed from door, position door hinge and adjustment shims (Item 10), if required, on the door. Align hinge with scribe marks at upper and lower corners on the door. Then install 6 mounting bolts (Item 9) securing them to the door. Tighten to 180 in-lbs. (20 Nm).
Install check arm assembly (Item 3) on door half of hinge and secure with 2 mounting bolts (Item 8).
Position cab door and hinge in place at cab door hinge pillar ( Item 2, Figure 40). Put electrical wire from interior and courtesy light door switch (Item 7) through mounting hole in hinge.
Place cab door and hinge with door check arm bracket (Item 4) on cab door hinge pillar and install 7 hinge mounting bolts (Item 5). Do not tighten mounting bolts.
Line up check arm bracket (Item 4) with mounting holes in cab door hinge pillar and install 2 mounting bolts (Item 6).
Tighten 7 hinge mounting bolts (Item 5) to 180 in-lbs. (20 Nm). Remove overhead support.
Position door check arm (Item 3) into door check arm bracket (Item 4) and install door check arm pin (Item 2), then install cotter pin (Item 1) in door check arm pin.
Connect electrical wire to interior and courtesy light door switch (Item 7) and install door switch into hinge.

note.para: If door has electric windows, courtesy lights, heated mirrors or CB antenna, reconnect wiring to door.

step1.para:
Adjust the door as required. Refer to ADJUSTMENTS, CAB DOOR
.
